stadium.name: The Sun-Baked Bowl
stadium.description: A simple, deep bowl dug from clay and sandstone on the edge of a caravan oasis. The heat is oppressive, and the 'stands' are just blankets laid on the sun-baked dunes.

stats.pregame_ritual: Eating a piece of honeycomb to 'sweeten' their victory.
Smelling a piece of burnt wood from a campfire.
Methodically tearing a large leaf into tiny, identical pieces.
Trying to teach a stray dog a complicated and useless new trick.
Humming a tune they believe only they know.
Tugging on their left earlobe three times.
Shaving one half of their mustache for important games.
Consulting a folk rhyme about the weather to predict the game's outcome.
Sticking a specific type of feather in their helmet's plume.
Organizing a small betting pool on who will score first.
Dipping their hands in a bucket of ice-cold well water.
Smelling a piece of burnt wood from a campfire.
Methodically tearing a large leaf into tiny, identical pieces.

Shaving one half of their mustache for important games.

stadium.name: The Oakmaul Grounds
stadium.description: Built over the site of the final battle during the liberation of Hafting now rises The Oakmaul Grounds‚Äîpart arena, part monument. The central oak still bears the burn scars of the final battle. Troll ball here feels more like ritual than sport.

stats.pregame_ritual: Wiggling their fingers in a complex, magical-looking pattern.
Tying their bootlaces together and hopping to the starting line.
Attempting to communicate with birds.
Chewing a specific, bitter root said to improve night vision.
Plucking a single hair from a teammate's beard for luck.
Rubbing the Trollball on their armpits for 'grip'.
Organizing a small betting pool on who will score first.
Asking the Trollball for advice, and pretending to listen to its response.
Smelling their own game-worn socks from the previous match.
Anointing their forehead with morning dew.
Performing a series of aggressive, theatrical poses.
Tying their bootlaces together and hopping to the starting line.
Chewing a specific, bitter root said to improve night vision.

preGame:
Hello, hello, hello, you beautiful monsters and bloodthirsty bettors! This is Nok the Corrupter, coming to you live from the Sun-Baked Bowl in the Great Desert for a Tuesday Night Trollball knockout! We are deep in the Losers Bracket of the playoffs, where the air is hotter than a dragon's breath and twice as dusty! It is Game 2 of this Best-of-3 series, and the pressure is higher than a mountain troll on a bender! The Greenwatch are up 1-0 after a narrow victory last week, and they are smelling blood in the sand tonight! üèüÔ∏èüåµ

Our home side, The Desert Spectres, are looking more than a little parched out there! They need this win to stay alive, or they'll be haunting the sidelines for the rest of the season. I just saw Angelita Darce backstage giving himself that signature half-mustache shave‚Äîtalk about commitment to the bit! Meanwhile, Muscolo Jaehne is frantically tearing leaves into identical little pieces. It‚Äôs that kind of obsessive-compulsive energy that makes for a great defender, or a very interesting dinner guest! Even with Geth the Gravelord lurking in the dunes, these Spectres need to find some life in their game! üíÄü™ì

But don't count out the visitors! The Greenwatch have arrived from the lush Oakmaul Grounds, and they are looking a bit out of place in this sandbox. Verne Methuselah is already rubbing the Trollball on her armpits for that 'special grip'‚Äîthat's the kind of homegrown Warden strategy that Sir Randy and his fancy, gold-plated bow probably find disgusting! And look at Nobe Haukom, sneaking around to pluck hairs from his teammates' beards for luck. If that doesn't scream 'playoff intensity,' I don't know what does! üå≥üî®

The crowd is a bit thin today‚Äîit seems the heat has kept the casuals away‚Äîbut the ones who are here are ready for some serious carnage! With the 'Intense Heat' and 'Dehydration' modifiers in play, we‚Äôre going to see who has the stomach for a desert brawl. Will the Greenwatch close it out, or will the Spectres drag them into a Game 3? Let‚Äôs get to the violence, folks! ‚òÄÔ∏èüèê
postGame:
Well, knock me down and call me a kobold, what a display of defensive dominance! The Greenwatch have shut down the Desert Spectres in a 2-0 defensive masterclass right here in the Sun-Baked Bowl! With this second victory in the bag, the Greenwatch sweep the series 2-0 and send the Spectres packing! It was a game of grit, sand, and a whole lot of horizontal players! üé§üí•

Things started off messy, just the way I like it! Angelita Darce managed to snag the Trollball early, but the Spectres were fumbling like they had butter on their fingers‚Äîor maybe just too much sand! Between wild passes and dropped balls, it was a comedy of errors until the real violence began. You could tell the 'Intense Heat' was already rattling the Spectres' brains, while the Greenwatch looked ready to harvest some souls! üåµ‚òÄÔ∏è

The first real highlight came when Rese Halpern decided she‚Äôd had enough of Eileen Mikihisa‚Äôs nonsense. She delivered a tackle so hard it probably left a permanent dent in the sandstone! Eileen went down and stayed down, needing a quick visit from the healer. It set a tone for the afternoon: if you carry the ball, you're going to pay for it in teeth! ü§ïü¶∑

Then we saw Herriott Dhiren go on an absolute rampage! She didn't just play the game; she dismantled the Spectres' roster. First, she leveled Muscolo Jaehne, then she turned her sights on Shelman McQuoid, sending him to the sand with a sickening thud. Herriott was playing like she had a personal grudge against anyone wearing desert colors! It‚Äôs the kind of cold-blooded efficiency that would make even the assassin King Dima nod in approval! üó°Ô∏èüí™

But the carnage didn't stop there! Salahi Bushey got in on the action, using his sap to put Huesman Ring into the dirt. Shortly after, Nobe Haukom‚Äîprobably powered by those lucky beard hairs‚Äîabsolutely demolished Heyes Iver. The Spectres were dropping like flies in a heatwave, and the healers were working overtime just to keep enough bodies on the field to call it a match! ü©∏üöë

At halftime, both teams retreated to what little shade they could find. The dehydration was clearly setting in, and you could see the Spectres looking longingly at the horizon for a rain cloud that was never coming. The Greenwatch, however, seemed to thrive in the chaos, perhaps drawing some lingering power from their 'Ritual Focus' back home, even in this clay bowl! üçØ‚òÄÔ∏è

When we got back to it, Darin Berliner decided to finish what the heat started. She tracked down Angelita Darce and delivered a tackle that was more theatrical than a Prismatic Troupe performance! Angelita‚Äôs half-mustache didn't save him from the Bardiche, and he was carted off to join his teammates in the injury tent. At this point, the Spectres were running on fumes and desperation! üé≠üî®

Then came the play of the game! Drona Jacklin, who I hear was winning her own betting pool on the sidelines, took the ball in Center Field. She didn't bother running; she just wound up and let fly a 'Shoot' that cut through the sandstorm like a hot knife through butter! It sailed through the goal for 2 points, giving the Greenwatch a lead that felt like a mountain in this linear desert! üéØ‚ú®

The Spectres tried to mount a comeback, but it was like watching a one-legged goblin try to outrun a wolf. Steve tried to advance the ball several times but was met with a wall of Greenwatch steel every single time. The defense was so suffocating that the Spectres couldn't even get a pass off without a Warden-allied mallet threatening their collarbones! üê∫üö´

In a final act of desperation, Huesman Ring and Fidellia Mozelle both took wild shots from the Away Field, but the heat must have been blurring their vision. The balls sailed wide, landing in the dunes where only the scorpions could enjoy them. It was a pathetic end for a team that historically had so much promise, but that's Trollball in the playoffs‚Äîit's cruel, it's hot, and it doesn't care about your feelings! ü¶ÇüèúÔ∏è

So, there you have it! The Greenwatch win 2-0 and take the series sweep! They move on in the Losers Bracket, while the Desert Spectres are officially out of the running. I‚Äôd offer them a drink, but I think Imra would charge them triple for the 'recovery elixir.' As for the so-called 'heroes' like Falric or Sir Randy, I hope they were watching, because this is what real work looks like‚Äîsweaty, bloody, and entirely unnecessary! This is Nok the Corrupter signing off! Stay corrupt, Osterra! üçªüèÜ
